stream_context.summary: Kaze modeled a new paper-craft Thwomp enemy with movable googly eyes, then live-integrated the second major Course 1 overhaul sent by Biobak, fixing lighting, materials, and draw-order bugs while discussing broader game design and technical constraints.

development_findings.summary: Designed a folded-paper Thwomp enemy (≈164 tris) whose eyes can track the player and rattle when it slams; cardboard eyebrows and a cardboard mouth were chosen after trying duct-tape and origami looks.
development_findings.quote: This Thwomp will have the ability to look around, and I can make the googly eyes just fly around when he does his attack.

development_findings.summary: Biobak delivered a full re-work of Course 1 (geometry, lighting, new skybox, carrot-filled cave, vine-wrapped slide, redesigned boss castle). Kaze merged it, corrected broken material flags (Z-buffer, smooth-shading, 2-cycle combiner) and documented remaining to-dos.
development_findings.quote: Time for my weekly Course 1 rework… development time spent on Course 1 is probably like seven percent.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a new high-damage "soul enemy" off-stream; still needs SFX/GFX feedback to feel complete.
Game structure confirmed: 15 sandbox courses; each open world hides entrances to linear challenges or puzzles instead of single stars.
development_findings.quote: Basically nothing in this game is mandatory if you're good at the game, and that's the beauty.

development_findings.summary: Runs on real N64 hardware; enemies range 60–300 polygons; LODs considered unnecessary until Fast64 supports branch C.
development_findings.quote: I'm not really a believer in LOTs. They’re very overrated with the current setup.

development_findings.summary: Technical rule: any material using more than one texture must be forced to two-cycle mode; forgetting this caused transparency bugs during the merge.
development_findings.quote: Whenever you use more than one texture in the material, you are 100 percent forced to use two cycle and there’s nothing you can do about it.

development_findings.summary: Planned boss-fight tweak: keep King mobile and have boulders chase the player instead of King being on a ‘treadmill’.
development_findings.quote: Quick and easy way to make it 100 percent meta would be to have the boulders follow you instead.

development_findings.summary: Lighting pass decisions: retro section uses mainly camera lighting; underground set to darker ambience with a glowing mushroom point light; boss arena lit from above with slight angle.
Visual/collision mismatch on slides intentionally kept for extra difficulty after chat discussion.
development_findings.quote: References should not match; there should be no collision at all.

context_findings.summary: Kaze insists on continually improving names and assets, never settling for ‘good enough’.
context_findings.quote: I would never just be like ‘Yep, we found the perfect thing.’

context_findings.summary: Shows strong attachment to canonical feel (e.g., refuses to give Thwomp a mustache).
context_findings.quote: I want this to look like a Thwomp. It’s very important to me. I love the Thwomp.

context_findings.summary: Moment of irritation toward release-date pressure; tells chat to ‘shut the fuck up’.
context_findings.quote: Please release before Christmas—Please, Kaze—Please… Please shut the fuck up. Leave me be.

context_findings.summary: Had to cut stream short for Thanksgiving dinner, illustrating real-life scheduling constraints.
context_findings.quote: I should be heading out around 4:15, so we’ve got an hour.

context_findings.summary: Believes modern games are too easy; intentionally keeps some visual ambiguity and platforming challenge.
context_findings.quote: Games have gotten too easy. We need a bit of difficulty.

context_findings.summary: Reconsidering original plot where Bowser enslaves Yoshis; feels ‘full-on slavery plot’ may be too dark for Mario tone.
context_findings.quote: A whole slavery plot is maybe a bit too much for a Mario game.

biobak.summary: Provided second full Course 1 overhaul including geometry, lighting, carrot cave, updated castle, and performance optimizations (claimed 10 fewer polygons than previous build).
biobak.quote: Even with all things I added, for some unknown reason it is ten fewer polygons than the original.

biobak.summary: Requested camera-only lighting in retro section and specific moving platforms layouts; Kaze implemented most requests live.

zeina.summary: May create a replacement red Goomba banner for the boss castle after original asset was lost.
zeina.quote: Zeina says she will offer to make a red banner.

key_stories.title: Crafting the Paper Thwomp
key_stories.summary: Kaze experiments live to turn a classic stone Thwomp into a believable folded-paper enemy. He debates materials, adds cardboard eyebrows, programs eye movement, and matches N64 limits.
key_stories.challenge: Making the Thwomp look like construction paper rather than stone while keeping its iconic anger.
key_stories.process: Tried shiny texture, then origami folds, then darker tris for depth; adjusted UVs; added googly-eye rig and cardboard features.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on a folded-cube design with movable eyes and cardboard facial parts, slated to finish polish off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Does he look enough like he’s made out of construction paper?

key_stories.title: Course 1 Rework Marathon
key_stories.summary: Biobak ships a surprise Course 1 remodel minutes before Kaze must leave for Thanksgiving. Kaze speed-fixes lighting and material glitches live while documenting needed tweaks.
key_stories.challenge: Integrate large asset update riddled with render-order and material flag issues before end of stream.
key_stories.process: Identified missing Z-buffers, smooth shading flags, and two-cycle requirements; adjusted lighting sets; noted follow-up tasks.
key_stories.outcome: Level boots at ~50 FPS with most visual bugs resolved; remaining optimizations deferred to next session.
key_stories.key_quote: Time for my weekly Course 1 rework… we got done with the important parts.

open_questions.context: Kaze scrapped the ‘Bowser enslaves Yoshis’ storyline but has no replacement yet.
questions: What new narrative stakes will replace the discarded slavery plot?
How does the story tie into course themes like construction-paper visuals?

open_questions.context: Idea to make boulders follow the player instead of the King looking ‘on a treadmill’.
questions: Has the team decided on final boss behaviour?
What technical steps are required to implement moving boulders that track Mario?

open_questions.context: Biobak requested camera lighting only, but Kaze mixed camera and ambient; unsure if final aesthetic is approved.
questions: What is the agreed lighting approach for the retro slide area?
Are there performance ramifications of camera-only lighting on N64 hardware?

open_questions.context: Multiple material settings (smooth shading, Z-buffer, cycle mode) arrived corrupted in Biobak’s file.
questions: What caused the material flag corruption?
Can the team standardize Blender/Fast64 versions to prevent repeat issues?

open_questions.context: Soul enemy and Thwomp lack audio-visual feedback; Badub was not present.
questions: What is the timeline for composing and implementing sound effects for new enemies?
How will sound memory limits on N64 be managed?
